pros: Management is great and truly cares. Change is possible. Twice yearly raises are a plus. Beautiful new facility.

cons: Building of new hospital caused many interruptions in educational opportunities and quality.

pros: Supportive fun staff to work with in a rural community hospital

cons: I don’t have any cons. Employee oriented.

job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Tomah, WI
pros: Great coworkers, good hours, good pay, great flexibility
cons: Sometimes there is a lack of communication

review_title: Great work environment, great co-workers, and leadership that listens
pros:
I've worked for Tomah Memorial Hospital for 5 years and I LOVE my job here. My coworkers are kind and fun and I feel like the leadership really cares and listens to employee concerns. I expanded a lot of the programming in my department and because of the increased work load, I was having trouble balancing my work and personal life. I spoke with my supervisor about the issue, and we were able to rework my schedule and the hospital added another position to help mange the new work load. It really meant a lot to me that the administration heard my concerns and worked with me to solve the issue. 

Not only does the leadership listen, but the benefits are really competitive. All employees and their immediate families receive 50% all hospital services, we receive great annual raises, and we also receive an annual bonus on top of the annual raise if we hit our target numbers (since I've worked here, I've always received at least a 1.5% bonus of my wages, but depending on our numbers, it can be up to a 3% bonus ).  If you'd like to go back to school, you can receive scholarship money from the hospital and they are great about working with your school schedule and work schedule. They are very supportive of continuing education and have paid for all of my continuing education credits and have encouraged me to seek conferences and certifications in my field. They also send out annual employee satisfaction surveys and actually change things based on the survey results. 

I can't tell you how positive this experience has been for me. It's the kind of work environment where managers in different departments know you by name, and the CEO stops by just to check in. There are not many companies where the CEO is actually known by the staff and makes an effort to be available and open to all staff, not just the managers. Because Tomah Memorial has it's governing structure within the hospital, it is also WAY faster for necessary process changes to be made because they don't have to go through 15 different departments at a corporate level. I recommend that you try out Tomah Memorial, it's the best job I've ever had.
cons: Because of the type of work I do, sometimes my schedule is challenging to manage. Luckily, I brought this issue to my supervisor and they helped me work though it. They even ended up adding a position to help!

pros: I have worked here for 4.5 years and I love it!  It is a very different environment then my previous employment.   All the staff are welcoming and helpul.  I have also been able to expand on my previous knowledge and take other jobs  and add to my job daily.
cons: It is sometimes difficult to get everything done when there is a full house and outside meetingsl

pros: Very tight-knit community of employees and managers, all the way up to Phil, our CEO. I feel like I know my co-workers and they know who I am. Our departments are always willing to lend a hand to others and very knowledgeable when it comes to helping each other out.
cons: I don't really feel there are any cons to my employment here. I enjoy my position, my department, and my co-workers.

pros: Professional and friendly staff, concerned about patient and staff safety, always working toward better and more efficient processes and workflow, critical access hospital
cons: Because we are a small hospital not every test or procedure is offered here

pros:

cons: None that I have found so far.
